p: The phytochemical analyses of the extract of the genus Sideritis have shown various constituents [ 5, 8], such as terpenoids, coumarins, sterols, and especially flavonoid aglycones and glycosides. The chemical composition of S. raeseri has been reported earlier [ 7]. Sideritis constituents have been reported to exert various biological activities [ 5, 7, 9â€“ 12], including antitussive, stomachic, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, antinociceptive, carminative, antioxidant [ 10], vasoprotective, hypoglycemic, anti-HIV replication, antifeedant, antiulcer, anticataract, and immunomodulating functions, as well as hypotensive, vasorelaxant, and cardiodepressant activities [ 11].
